author: Harper Lee
review: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
review: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A novel of the Jazz Age that examines the American dream and the high life of 1920s America.

author: Jane Austen
review: A romantic novel of manners that satirizes the societal expectations of the early 19th century.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A story about teenage rebellion and angst, and the protagonist Holden Caulfield's cynical outlook on life.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A fantasy novel that serves as a prelude to the Lord of the Rings series, featuring the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

author: Herman Melville
review: A complex novel that explores themes of obsession, revenge, and the nature of evil, centered around the quest to capture the elusive white whale.

author: Leo Tolstoy
review: An epic novel that intertwines the lives of private and public individuals during the time of the Napoleonic wars.

author: Joseph Heller
review: A satirical war novel about the absurdities of war and bureaucracy, centered around the experiences of Captain John Yossarian.
